SENT.plain: We describe a case of de novo myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS) with hypotriploidy, a condition in which polypoid chromosome abnormalities are rarely observed
A 64-year-old male was diagnosed with refractory anemia with ring sideroblasts (RARS)

One month later, rapid transformation to refractory anemia with excess of blasts in transformation was observed in spite of a hematological improvement obtained by therapy with corticosteroids, anabolic steroids and pyridoxine
Two months after the diagnosis of RARS, he died of multiple organ failure
In our case, the hypotriploid chromosome abnormality may have represented a poor prognosis
